intro: Pogonophora letouzeyi, commonly known as the African pogonophora, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. The botanical features of Pogonophora letouzeyi make it a notable species for both ornamental and ecological purposes.
